articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Leaves to Participate in Olympics Opening
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Leaves to Participate in Olympics Opening
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, left here Wednesday to participate in the opening ceremony of the 22nd Winter Olympic Games to be held in Sochi, Russia as an honorary guest.
					 He was accompanied by Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other suite members.
					
					 They were seen off at the airport by Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the SPA, Pak Myong Guk, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Son Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports who is also vice-chairman of the DPRK Olympic Committee, and Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: North-South Red Cross Working Contact Made
articles.content:
North-South Red Cross Working Contact Made
 Panmunjom, February 5 (KCNA) -- North-south Red Cross working contact was made at the Thongil House in the north's portion of Panmunjom Wednesday for the reunion of separated families and their relatives.
					 At the contact both sides discussed the issues arising in successfully ensuring the reunion of separated families and their relatives before adopting an agreement.
					
					 According to it, the north and the south decided to hold the reunion at Mt. Kumgang resort from Feb. 20 to 25, 2014 and agreed to fix the number of the persons involved in the event according to the final lists exchanged last year and follow practice as regards the way and method of arranging the reunion.
					
					 Both sides decided to arrange indoor reunion instead of outdoor reunion, taking weather conditions into consideration, and hold group reunion at the Mt. Kumgang Reunion Centre and Kumgangsan Hotel.
					
					 It was also decided to open the north-south Red Cross working contact after the event to further the discussion on settling humanitarian issues.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Laos Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Laos Appointed
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Ri Sang Gun was appointed as DPRK ambassador to Laos, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift from Chinese
articles.content:
Gift from Chinese
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the head of the Chinese delegation of the Dongfangyi Tuozhan Association on a visit to the DPRK.
					 It was conveyed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Dongfang Yi, chairperson of the association, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of Women's Union Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of Women's Union Held
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The 67th Enlarged Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea took place here on Feb. 4 and 5.
					 The meeting discussed the tasks of women's union organizations to devotedly carry out the important tasks set forth by Marshal Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address and more thoroughly establish the monolithic leadership system of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the union, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers called on women's union organizations to increase their function and role, prepare the union members to be true Kimilsungists and Kimjongilists and consolidate the single-minded unity of the revolutionary ranks this significant year marking the 40th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's proclamation of modeling whole society on Kimilsungism.
					
					 They called for concentrating all efforts on the ideological campaign, information and agitation activities for giving full play to the mental power of the masses and actively organizing various do-good-thing movements and socialist emulation drive for increased production which are conductive to building a thriving nation.
					
					 They also called for consolidating the ideological and purposeful unity and revolutionary unity of the ranks of the union in every way and further enhance the function and role of women's union organizations, holding Kim Jong Un in high esteem as the unitary center of unity and leadership.
					
					 Decisions were adopted at the meeting.
					
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the Central Committee of the women's union and its officials in Pyongyang and local areas.

articles.title: Film Show Held to Mark Day of Shining Star
articles.content:
Film Show Held to Mark Day of Shining Star
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- A film show took place at the Taedongmun Cinema here on Wednesday to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star).
					 Invited there were foreign diplomatic envoys, representatives of international bodies and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned and creators and artistes in the field of the films.
					
					 The participants watched feature film "A Member of Explosives Defusing Team."

articles.title: State Academic Degrees Conferred on Intellectuals of Meritorious Service
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees Conferred on Intellectuals of Meritorious Service
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles of the DPRK were conferred on intellectuals who made a positive contribution to registering great successes in building a thriving nation by vigorously conducting the drive to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology in the flames of the industrial revolution in the new century, on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The title of candidate academician was awarded to Jon Min Ung and So Ui Hwa, researchers at Kim Il Sung University, Pak Sung Nam, department head of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Ryu Sun Chan, teacher at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, and Ri Yong Su, researcher at Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering.
					
					 The professorship went to Kim Won Guk, department head of Kim Il Sung University, So Jung Nam, Kim Pom Ju and Kim Kyong Ra, teachers at the same university, Ri Myong Chol, vice-rector of Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, Chae Hui Won, department head of the same university, Ri Pong Sok, faculty dean of the University of Sciences, Sin Tong Chol, section chief of Pyongyang Jang Chol Gu University of Commerce, Choe Jong Su, faculty dean of Phyongsong University of Coal Mining, Choe Won Jong, researcher at the Geology Institute of the State Academy of Sciences, Han Pong U, researcher at the Central Mining Research Institute of the academy, Ryang Hyong Chan, researcher at the Coal Mining Engineering Institute of the Coal Science Branch of the academy, and Ju Sung, researcher at the Hamhung Branch of the academy.
					
					 The doctorate was conferred on Ri Song Chol and Kim Chol Hyok, department heads of Kim Il Sung University, Pak Chol, vice department head of the same university, Ri Yong Gil, faculty dean of Kye Ung Sang Agricultural College of Kim Il Sung University, Hong Song Ryong, vice-president of Pyongyang University of Architecture, Paek Nam Hyok, rector of the same university, and 45 other persons.
					
					 The assistant professorship went to 168 persons.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.

articles.title: Best Paddlers of DPRK for 2013
articles.content:
Best Paddlers of DPRK for 2013
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong of the April 25 Sports Team were selected as best man and woman table tennis players of the DPRK for Juche 102 (2013).
					 They won gold medals in the mixed doubles of the 52nd ITTF World Championships (individual event) and the 6th East Asian Games last year.
					
					 They are the country's first world champions in the mixed doubles. They recently received the ITTF 2013 table tennis star awards.
					
					 Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong are also on the list of the 10 best athletes of the country for 2013.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has brought out four kinds of new individual stamps with the approach of the 22nd Olympic Winter Games due in Russia from Feb. 7 to 23.
					 Seen in the upper part of the stamps are the Korean and English letters reading "22nd Olympic Winter Games in Sochi, Russia in 2014".
					
					 All of the stamps feature the emblem of the DPRK Olympic Committee, each with a picture showing the playing of ski, speed skating, ice hockey and bobsleigh.

articles.title: DPRK's Sports Aces (3)
articles.content:
DPRK's Sports Aces (3)
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Among sports aces of the DPRK is Han Phil Hwa who was once called a star on the ice.
					 Han, strong in physical strength and fast in running, began speed skating in her early teens.
					
					 She took the first place several times in national juvenile skating tournaments before joining the Pyongyang Sports Team.
					
					 In Juche 53 (1964), she clinched a silver medal at the women's 3,000-meter speed skating event in the 9th Winter Olympics held in Innsbruck, Austria.
					
					 She was the first Asian who won a medal in the 40-year-long history of Winter Olympics.
					
					 She bagged more than 20 gold and other medals at international and local tournaments, including the World Speed Skating Championship.
					
					 She, winner of Kim Il Sung Prize and the title of People's Athlete, served as a speed skating coach, deputy department director of the then Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission and others.
					
					 She is still working hard for the nation's sports development.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Feats Lauded: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Feats Lauded: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The nomination of supreme leader Kim Jong Un as a candidate for deputy to the 13th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK was an expression of the party members, service personnel and all other people's boundless reverence, absolute trust and intense loyalty to him, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an editorial.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Only the leader possessed of brilliant ideological and theoretical wisdom, distinguished political caliber, outstanding leadership art and noble traits can enjoy absolute support and trust from the people.
					
					 Kim Jong Un has developed in depth Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism as the unique guidelines of the DPRK and made sure that the Socialist Constitution was formulated as Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Constitution. This is of great historical significance in the struggle for achieving a final victory in the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Kim Jong Un has always put the interests of the country and the nation above all in the period of steering the revolution and construction and firmly protected the sovereign dignity of the DPRK with his outstanding leadership.
					
					 He is providing wise leadership over all affairs to bring about a dramatic turn not only in the building of the party and army but on all fronts for building a thriving nation including the economy and culture.
					
					 Believing in people as in Heaven is the lifelong maxim of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It is necessary to give priority to the interests and conveniences of the people and take care of sick and wounded persons with warm affection and heart. This is Kim Jong Un's noble outlook based on love and trust.
					
					 For the army and the people in the DPRK Kim Jong Un's care represents its care and its dignity means his high prestige.
					
					 All service personnel and people across the country should single-mindedly remain true to his idea and leadership, preserving blood ties with him. Herein lie the invincible might and bright future of the DPRK, the editorial concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Remaining True to Idea of By Our Nation Itself
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Remaining True to Idea of By Our Nation Itself
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The idea of By Our Nation Itself is the basic principle and way for the Korean nation to independently carve out its destiny, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The idea was advanced as the core of the historic June 15 joint declaration as desired by the Korean nation in the new century and as required by the movement for national reunification.
					
					 The first paragraph of the declaration says that the north and the south of Korea decided to independently settle the issue of the reunification of the nation by concerted efforts of the Koreans responsible for it. 
					
					 The idea calls for rejecting foreign forces and achieving the reunification of the country by efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 Only when Koreans cherish this idea, can they have confidence in the united strength of the nation and make positive efforts to achieve the national unity, guided by the idea.
					
					 It is an intrinsic requirement of the movement for national reunification to achieve the national unity.
					
					 It is quite natural to settle the issue of the inter-Korean ties from the standpoint of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The north and the south should resolve all issues on the principle of independence and unity from the firm standpoint, the idea of reunification common to the nation.
					
					 It is not a right attitude to argue about the sincerity of the patriotic efforts of fellow countrymen to pave the way for mending the north-south relations by concerted efforts of the Korean nation, and doubt it.
					
					 It is a key issue in shaping out the destiny of the nation independently to hold aloft the banner of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 Independent reunification, peace and prosperity will come earlier when all Koreans in the north, the south and abroad struggle in firm unity, guided by the noble idea.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- In reference to the strong demand of the international community that the Japanese government should settle the issue of sexual slavery properly, the Japanese reactionaries are keeping a straight face, claiming that they made enough apologies and reparations. Commenting on this, Minju Joson Wednesday says:
					 This is a barbarous act of rubbing salt into the wounds of hundreds of thousands of victims in Asia whose all rights as human being were violated by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The crimes perpetrated by Japan in the past can not be glossed over as they are monstrous in their brutality and gravity.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists took hundreds of thousands of women to battlefields and ruthlessly violated their dignity. Such crimes are without precedent in the world war history. It is none other than Japan that produced the biggest tragic story in the 20th century.
					
					 What is painful in particular is the fact that many victims who sustained misfortunes and sufferings by Japan in the past are passing away without hearing even a word of sincere apology from the Japanese authorities.
					
					 This goes to prove that Japan is repeating the crimes against humanity. Humankind will never remain a passive onlooker to this grave situation.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better make a bold decision to end the crime-woven history at an early date, bearing in mind that there will be no future of Japan if it does not repent of its past crimes.

articles.title: KCNA Terms US Worst Security-threatening Country
articles.content:
KCNA Terms US Worst Security-threatening Country
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet designated the DPRK as a "state of biggest security concern" in the Asia-Pacific region, when he recently told reporters about the non-existent "WMD threat" from it.
					 In the meantime, the commander-in-chief of the U.S. Armed Forces in the Pacific said that a scenario had been worked out to cope with any "unexpected developments", asserting that nuclear threat from the DPRK is a source of trouble not only to the U.S. mainland but also to the Korean Peninsula and that it may plunge the whole world into confusion.
					
					 Such absurd remarks are a trick to justify their military reinforcement for the U.S. pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy. Their action contrary to the facts reminds one of an offender assaulting a victim.
					
					 The U.S. is the very one that seriously threatens the peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the Asia-Pacific region, bringing calamity. It was proven by its history of hostility against the DPRK.
					
					 In the last century the U.S. started a war of aggression in Korea and shifted the blame for it on to the DPRK to justify its criminal atrocities while plunging the Korean nation into an unprecedented calamity.
					
					 After the ceasefire it has kept its forces in a half of Korea for an indefinite period allegedly to protect south Korea from "threat of socialism", persistently escalating nuclear blackmail to ignite another war.
					
					 After the Cold War it cooked up such new pretexts as "suspected nuclear development in north Korea" and "nuclear threat" to get hell-bent on the anti-DPRK moves.
					
					 In recent years the U.S. deployed many troops and nuclear strike means and other lethal weapons in the Asia-Pacific region, calling the DPRK to task, and turned the Korean Peninsula into the most dangerous region where a nuclear war may break out any moment.
					
					 All the facts go to prove that the U.S. is the world's worst security-threatening and wrecking state. With any sophism can it never deny this stark fact, recognized by the world community.
					
					 The U.S. has deployed thousands of nuclear warheads for action and seeks to spend about 400 billion dollars in coming years for the modernization of its nukes. So, it is natural that the world public has derided the U.S. labeling the DPRK as a "security-threatening state".
					
					 The U.S. had better behave itself, pondering over what catastrophic consequences its reckless moves for world domination will bring.

articles.title: Acquittal of Those Related to UPP Case Called for
articles.content:
Acquittal of Those Related to UPP Case Called for
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Members of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) of south Korea held a meeting outside the Suwon Local Court on Feb. 3, according to Jaju Minbo, an Internet paper of south Korea.
					 The speakers at the meeting accused the prosecution of demanding 20 years in prison for Ri Sok Gi, member of the "National Assembly", and heavy penalties for others related to the UPP case.
					
					 The course of hearing disclosed that the recorded lecture which the Intelligence Service produced as convincing evidence was fabricated and testimonies made by witnesses of hearing at the attempted rebellion were tailored to serve its purpose.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the action taken by the prosecution goes to clearly prove that it was reduced to a waiting maid of the power.
					
					 They declared they would stage positive actions for the acquittal of the victims of the case.

articles.title: Disbandment of IS Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Disbandment of IS Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Catholics in south Korea held a mass on the situation at Sogang University on Monday in demand of the disbandment of the Intelligence Service (IS), according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 At the mass the speakers called for a special investigation for probing truth behind the IS's illegal interference in the election.
					
					 The IS should not be simply reformed but be totally disbanded, they stressed.
					
					 They demanded a severe punishment of those involved in the interference including Lee Myung Bak, the director of the IS and the cyber commander.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet Paper Accuses Japan of Reviving Militarism
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Paper Accuses Japan of Reviving Militarism
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People in an editorial accused Japan of reviving militarism on Monday.
					 The editorial recalled that the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan decided to describe Tok Islets as an "inalienable part of the territory of Japan" in the "explanation of study guidebook", which would serve as guidelines for editing textbooks for junior and senior high schools.
					
					 As a result, Tok Islets would be more likely to be described as "part of the territory of Japan" in textbooks for junior high schools from 2016 and in those for senior high schools from 2017, it noted, adding:
					
					 Worse still, Prime Minister Abe is letting loose a spate of sophism negating and distorting the past history of Japan on a daily basis after his visit to Yasukuni Shrine.
					
					 While crying out for ignoring the recommendation made by the UN Anti-Torture Committee as regards the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, Abe again raised the issue of "dominium over Tok Islets" and called for bringing it to the International Court of Justice.
					
					 Lurking behind it is the ulterior design of Japan to step up its moves to turn it into a military giant with the backing of Washington.
					
					 Terming Japan's moves to revive militarism a factor of escalating tension in Northeast Asia, the editorial noted that the issue of "dominium over Tok Islets" is not a simple issue of the past but a serious one at present.

articles.title: Stop to Planned Military Drills Urged by Koreans' Newspaper in Japan
articles.content:
Stop to Planned Military Drills Urged by Koreans' Newspaper in Japan
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Minjok Sibo, Koreans' newspaper in Japan, on Feb. 1 carried an article urging the south Korean authorities to cancel the joint military drills which they are going to stage with the U.S. and opt for improving the relations with the north.
					 The article recalled that the National Defence Commission of the DPRK sent the south Korean authorities a crucial proposal calling for paving a wide avenue for improving the inter-Korean relations by concerted efforts of all Koreans in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The crucial proposal underlined the need to completely stop all acts provoking and slandering each other, urged the south Korean authorities to make a bold political decision to cancel the projected Key Resolve and Foal Eagle and take practical measures to prevent a nuclear disaster, the article said.
					
					 Whoever is concerned for the life and security of people will not turn down the crucial proposal of the north, it noted, urging the south Korean authorities to respond to the proposal as early as possible.
					
					 It is only the U.S. that will benefit from the escalated tension on the Korean peninsula, the article said, calling for building up peace-loving public opinion to have the projected military drills cancelled.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Posted on Website of Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Posted on Website of Ecuador
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's New Year Address was jointly posted on website by the Kim Jong Il Library and the Juche Youth Group in Ecuador on Jan. 29.

articles.title: Highest Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il by Beninese Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Highest Tribute Paid to Kim Jong Il by Beninese Political Party Leader
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- All members of the Socialist Party of Benin pay the highest tribute to leader Kim Jong Il who made an immortal contribution to the world socialist movement and the struggle to accomplish the human cause of independence on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, said this in his statement issued on January 27 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said:
					
					 It was a noteworthy event in accomplishing the human cause of independence that Kim Jong Il formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as an integral system of ideology, theory and method of Juche.
					
					 Kim Jong Il authored many works including "On the Juche Idea," developing and comprehensively systemizing the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He made public a series of works including "Socialism Is a Science" late in the  20th century when imperialists were talking a lot about the "end  of socialism," thus proving the truth and validity of the socialist cause and its sure victory and clarifying overall theoretical and practical issues arising in accomplishing the human cause of independence.
					
					 He created an international climate favorable for the DPRK and made a great contribution to the establishment of fair international relations and the accomplishment of the human cause of independence through his energetic external activities.
					
					 He always considered independence, peace and friendship as the basic idea of external activities and paid deep attention to building a new independent world.

articles.title: Greatest Holidays of DPRK to Be Celebrated in Mexico
articles.content:
Greatest Holidays of DPRK to Be Celebrated in Mexico
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Mexican national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun) and the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated at the building of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico on January 29. 
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee. 
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and hold political and cultural events including meeting, seminar and lecture from February 1 to April 15.

articles.title: Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Regional Organization
articles.content:
Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Regional Organization
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization regards the crucial proposal of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK as the best way for opening up a wide avenue for improving the inter-Korean relations.
					 It said this in a statement issued on January 28 in support of the crucial proposal of the NDC of the DPRK.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 To improve the relations between the north and the south of Korea is a guarantee of a durable peace in Northeast Asia.
					
					 We hope that all the Korean people in the north and the south will improve the relations and build reunified powerful Korea in the course of stopping slandering the other side and respecting each other.

articles.title: Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Bulgarian, Nigerian Organizations
articles.content:
Proposal of NDC of DPRK Supported by Bulgarian, Nigerian Organizations
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Bulgaria and Nigeria made public statements on January 27 in support of the crucial proposal and open letter of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association said:
					
					 In order to ensure national security and peace the NDC of the DPRK proposed a halt to the projected U.S.-south Korea joint military drills which will drive the situation on the Korean peninsula to an extreme pitch of strain.
					
					 It is high time for the south Korean authorities to put an end to all sorts of hostile acts and ceaseless provocations being committed against the fellow countrymen at the instigation of the U.S.
					
					 We fully support the crucial proposal and open letter sent by the NDC of the DPRK to the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should lend an ear to the voice of the progressive people calling for peace on the Korean peninsula, not war.
					
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said that supreme leader Kim Jong Un indicated the realistic way of making a fresh advance in the national reunification movement this year, and went on:
					
					 We express full support and solidarity with the crucial proposal and open letter of the NDC of the DPRK, recognizing them as the most just and realistic way of paving a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations.
					
					 We also demand the authorities, various political parties, public organizations and people from all walks of life in south Korea respond to the above-said proposal and letter reflecting the desire and wish of all the Korean people and other progressive people.

articles.title: Egyptian Party Urges S. Korean Authorities to Respond to Proposal of DPRK
articles.content:
Egyptian Party Urges S. Korean Authorities to Respond to Proposal of DPRK
 Pyongyang, February 5 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt made public a statement on January 27 in support of the crucial proposal of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 We express full support and solidarity with the crucial proposal sent by the NDC of the DPRK to the south Korean authorities, recognizing it as the most realistic and fair one for achieving peace and stability on the Korean peninsula by concerted efforts of the Korean nation. 
					
					 The crucial proposal is a clear expression of the sincere efforts made by the DPRK government to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, the common desire of all the Korean people.
					
					 If another war breaks out on the Korean peninsula, only the Korean people will fall victim to horrible disaster. 
					
					 Therefore, we urge the south Korean authorities to respond to the crucial proposal of the NDC of the DPRK without delay.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam parte de Pyongyang rumbo a Sochi
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam parte de Pyongyang rumbo a Sochi
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, partio el dia 5 de esta capital para participar como huesped honorario en la ceremonia inaugural de los 22o Juegos Olimpicos Invernales a efectuarse en Sochi de Rusia.
					 Le acompanan el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung y otros.
					
					  En el aeropuerto les despidieron el vicepresidente del Presidum de la APS Yang Hyong Sop, el vicecanciller Pak Myong Guk, el vicepresidente del Comite Olimpico de la RPDC y viceministro de Deportes Son Kwang Ho,y Alexandr Timonin, embajador ruso en Corea.

articles.title: Tiene lugar contacto de trabajo de Cruz Roja Norte-Sur
articles.content:
Tiene lugar contacto de trabajo de Cruz Roja Norte-Sur
Phanmunjom, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 5 en el Pabellon Thongil en el area de la parte nortena de Phanmunjom el contacto de trabajo de la Cruz Roja Norte-Sur para el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados.
					Ambas partes abordaron los asuntos para garantizar con exito el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados y aprobaron el acuerdo.
					
					Segun el documento, el Norte y el Sur acordaron realizar del dia 20 al 25 de febrero de 2014 en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados.
					
					Decidieron fijar el tamano de encuentro segun la lista final cambiada por ambas partes en el ano pasado y hacer la forma y el metodo del encuentro conforme a la costumbre.
					
					Ambas partes acordaron realizar el encuentro al aire libre como encuentro bajo techo tomando en consideracion las condiciones meteorologicas y  el encuentro colectivo en el centro de visitas y el hotel Kumgangsan.
					
					Acordaron continuar la consulta para resolver los asuntos humanitarios mediante el contacto de trabajo de Cruz Roja Norte-Sur despues de terminar el acto de dicho encuentro.

articles.title: Colegios para elegir a Kim Jong Un como candidato a diputado a APS
articles.content:
Colegios para elegir a Kim Jong Un como candidato a diputado a APS
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 4 en los distritos electorales de las ciudades de Pyongyang, Sinuiju, Kanggye, Sariwon, Chongjin, Hamhung y Nampho y las instituciones de fuerzas armadas los colegios para elegir al Mariscal Kim Jong Un como candidato al diputado a la XIII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					En las ocasiones hubo informes e intervenciones.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que al levantar en alto la gran bandera del kimilsungismo-kimjongilismo el Mariscal dilucido la perenne estrategia de la revolucion coreana para avanzar rectamente por el camino de la independencia, el Songun y el socialismo y acumulo inmortales hazanas para el desarrollo de la RPDC.
					
					Prosiguieron que los uniformados y civiles coreanos, enalteciendo al Mariscal como centro de la unidad y la direccion, formaron un invicto baluarte uniendose compactamente con la unica ideologia, la conviccion y la camaraderia revolucionaria, lo cual constituye el verdadero aspecto de la RPDC.
					
					A traves de las experiencias practicas, el ejercito y pueblo sintieron profundamente que en el camino de seguir al Mariscal, quien posee las extraordinarias ideas y teorias, la destacada capacidad directiva y noble rasgo moral, hay el radiante futuro de la Corea del Songun y la victoria de la causa de la construccion de un Estado prospero socialista, acotaron.
					
					Reflejando el unanime deseo y aspiracion de todos los uniformados y civiles, los intervencionistas propusieron cortesmente elegir al Mariscal como candidato al diputado a la XIII Legislatura de la APS y los oradores y todos los participantes expresaron el pleno respaldo al respecto.
					
					Se declararon solemnemente el hecho de que por el unanime deseo y el absoluto respaldo de todos los electorados el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, fue electo en los respectivos distritos electorales como candidato al diputado a la XIII Legislatura de la APS.
					
					Ademas se aprobaron las cartas dirigidas al Mariscal.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia actitud descarada de autoridad japonesa
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia actitud descarada de autoridad japonesa
Pyongyang, 5 de febrero (ACNC) -- Recientemente, los reaccionarios japoneses dijeron que su pais "cumplio lo que debia hacer en cuanto a la disculpa e indemnizacion" despreciando la fuerte demanda de la sociedad internacional de resolver justamente el caso de esclavitud sexual cometido en el pasado por el viejo ejercito japones.
					En un comentario individual difundido este miercoles, el periodico Minju Joson lo califica de un barbaro proceder que vuelve a dar sablazos a la herida de corazon de cientos de miles de victimas asiaticas y continua:
					
					El crimen cometido por Japon en el pasado es demasiado grande en su brutalidad y gravedad.
					
					En la historia de las guerras del mundo no habia el caso de haber violado a cientos de miles de mujeres llevandolas a los campos de batalla pisoteando sin piedad sus dignidades humanas.
					
					La gran tragedia del siglo 20 fue cometida por Japon.
					
					Lo mas doloroso es que numerosas victimas mueren sin escuchar ni una palabra de disculpa de las autoridades japonesas.
					
					Esto muestra que el crimen antietico de Japon continua tambien hasta hoy.
					
					La humanidad nunca puede tolerarlo.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses deben tomar cuanto antes la decision de despedirse de su historia llena de crimenes dandose clara cuenta de que no habra el futuro de  su pais sin liquidar el pasado.
